findings.title: Non ERC20-Compliance Of CToken
findings.description: The `CToken` contract does not fully comply with the ERC20 specification, specifically with regards to state-changing functions such as transfer and transferFrom.

findings.title: Interface Inconsistency Between CErc20 And CEther
findings.description: The interfaces of CErc20 and CEther are inconsistent, with differences in error handling between functions such as replayBorrow(), repayBorrowBehalf(), mint(), and liquidateBorrow().

findings.title: Possible Front-Running For Unintended Payment In repayBorrowBehalf()
findings.description: Front-running attack is possible due to the generous assumption of using repayment amount of -1 as the indication of full repayment, allowing an attacker to launch a front-running borrow() operation and increase borrowing balance for repayment.

findings.title: Trust Issue of Admin Keys
findings.description: The administrative account 'admin' has critical roles and privileges to control or govern the flow of assets managed by various protocol contracts, posing a counter-party risk if it's a plain EOA account.
